name: Glop-c
tagline: Soft Body Physics w/ Velocity Verlet
body:
#About
Glop-c is an open source C engine for simulating deformable soft bodies in 2D. It's developed by Sam Murray under [the MIT License (MIT)](http://opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php). While this license does not require acknowledgement, I would appreciate a credit to Glop-c in your product.

##Glop-c Features
***
###Physics
* Elastic & destructable constraints
* SAT collision solving
* Fast broad-phase using AABB with spatial buckets
* Water & air resistance
* Thrusters, balloons, oscillators and other special body types

###System
* OSX & Unix platforms
* Multi-core support
* Light-weight code base at less than 100kb

###Testbed
* OpenGL GUI on [freeglut](http://freeglut.sourceforge.net/)
* Scriptable dev console
* JSON serialization

###Documentation
* User Manual
* Doxygen full brief

***

##Installation
Run the following code:
```
git clone https://github.com/samsface/glop-c.git
```
and copy the header and c files to you source code tree.

Alternatively, run ```make test``` to compile and run the test environment.

##Documentation
Full documentation can be found [here](http://github.io/glop-c/docs/).

##License
[The MIT License (MIT)](http://opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php)
